sections.title: Landlord Entry Requirements
sections.text: In Seattle, landlords must provide at least 48 hours written notice before entering a rental unit, except in emergencies. The notice must specify the date, approximate time, and purpose of entry. Entry without proper notice violates Seattle Municipal Code.

sections.title: Security Deposit Requirements
sections.text: In Seattle, security deposits must be refundable and returned within 14 days of lease termination with itemized deductions. Landlords cannot make deposits 'non-refundable' or exercise unilateral discretion over returns. There are limits on deposit amounts based on rent.

sections.title: Just Cause Eviction Protection
sections.text: In Seattle, landlords must have just cause to evict tenants. Evictions without cause are prohibited. Landlords cannot evict tenants in retaliation for exercising their rights or for organizing with other tenants.
